title: DS330.02 Architecture & Tools | DataStax Enterprise 6 Graph
description:
#DataStaxAcademy #DS330
DS330.02 Architecture & Tools
In this unit, we will dive deeper into the architecture of DataStax Enterprise Graph. We will take a look at the architecture from three perspectives: technologies, components, deployment. Then we'll look at the tools available for DataStax Enterprise Graph.

LEARN FOR FREE at https://academy.datastax.com -- access all the FREE complete courses, tutorials, and hands-on exercises.

ASK QUESTIONS at https://community.datastax.com -- where experts from DataStax & the Apache Cassandra community share their expertise everyday.

transcript.text: [Music] now let's dive a little deeper into the architecture of dse graph to do so we're going to use this format to guide the discussion first we'll take a look at the architecture from three unique perspectives technologies components and deployment then we'll look at the tools available for dse graph this is just the overview portion of this course so we'll keep things high level for now we'll start this discussion by viewing dse graph as a black box that powers graph applications the uppermost layer of dsc graph the view that's accessible directly from our clients is the gremlin apis spark apis and proprietary graph schemas and configuration apis dsc graph is able to capitalize on the robust responsive and resilient store layer of datastax's version of apache cassandra which is fully integrated with our search and analytics capabilities the middle layer is the proprietary code base that connects and optimizes the connection between the graph apis and the storage layer itself applications and users access data stored in dsc graph through the datastax drivers either using a string api or a builder style api we call the fluent api data stack studio is a fantastic visual tool that provides graph developers a visual way to interact with dse graph and optimize their gremlin code for those users that prefer a cli approach to development the open source gremlin console is also provided under the covers dsc graph projects a property graph model onto apache cassandra because dsc search is integrated into datastax's version of apache cassandra at right time data is automatically indexed by dsc search when search indexes are configured on a vertex dse graph exposes datastax's proprietary dsc search methods through the gremlin api to leverage the power of dc search through gremlin here you can see a high-level overview of how dse graph connects the api layer with a storage layer dsc graph exposes both the dse server for connections from datastax's drivers and the gremlin server for connections through the open source tinker pop drivers for olap processing dse analytics is automatically engaged just like a standard dsc cluster topology users of dse graph can achieve workload isolation through the visual data center concept this means users can ensure that oltp and olap workloads do not interfere with each other without the need to manually extract or move data between environments because dsc graph is built on datastax's version of apache cassandra data is replicated throughout the cluster here we see a screenshot of dse studio the visual tool developers use to explore their graph interact with cql optimize and debug gremlin and with the latest release interact with spark sql dse studio is a tremendous help to users creating graph databases in dse graph particularly developers who appreciate a visual understanding of their graph for those users who come from an open source graph database background or who prefer a command line experience the gremlin console exposes gremlin to end users through a fully open source compatible cli tool when users need to load data into dsc graph they have several choices use dsc graph frames to bulk load data quickly and easily through spark create custom loading applications using the dse driver and the fluent batch api or use a dse graph loader utility which can import and process flat files as well as graph specific file formats like ryo because dse graph is a part of the dse product suite all of the great management tools that are available for dse work with dse graph this includes ops center which can be used for automated deployments backups and other operational needs now it's your turn to explore a dsc graph please work through the exercise we'll be ready to pick up with the next section of the course when you return
